utterance: Crystal Rogers: I thought it would be easier if we type our own names rather than forcing you to do it.

annotations.explain or define term or concept: The speaker is explaining the reasoning behind a decision to have everyone type their own names, clarifying the intention to simplify the process.

utterance: Shwetadwip Choudhury: Sure. Oh, well perhaps we do these short introductions first.

annotations.propose decision: The speaker suggests a concrete action for the group to take, which is to do short introductions first.

utterance: Brad Smith: And then maybe we spend a minute writing down our thought or you can be in writing your thought while somebody introduces. So uh

annotations.propose decision: Brad suggests spending a minute writing down thoughts while someone introduces themselves, proposing a way to structure the meeting.

annotations.encourage particpatioin: Shwetadwip is likely encouraging someone else to participate or speak, as indicated by the phrase "May I" which implies he is yielding the floor.

utterance: Brad Smith: Fanny, I see your name in my screen. Do you want to go first?

annotations.encourage particpatioin: Brad Smith is inviting Fanny to speak first.

utterance: Fanny Chapelin: Sure, yes. Um, Fanny Chapelin at University of Kentucky. Um, I work mostly on
